title: cmd/pushback: rename to gopherbot?
body:
I keep having little idea for Go github automation, but I don't do it because I don't want to run a new server (lazy).

But I realize we already have cmd/pushback running with Github API access, so perhaps we turn cmd/pushback into the general gopherbot server and put more stuff in there?

e.g. I'd like a way to assign issues to people who aren't yet a member of our "go-assignees" Team. Perhaps I could summon @gopherbot to do it for me, like:

"Yo @gopherbot, assign @xxxxxxxxxx"

And gopherbot would manage both the process of inviting them to the team, awaiting the invite, and then doing the github issue assignment.

@adg, thoughts?
